content.text:
# Draft:Ring Warner

----
William "Ring" Warner,  (October.2, 1940-March 17, 2006) was an American double bass player. Ring Warner received his BA in Music from Northwestern University.
He held the principal bass position with the Phoenix Symphony.  After moving to Seattle, he served as principal bass with the Pacific Northwest Ballet Orchestra and the Northwest Chamber Orchestra and the Seattle Symphony  . Warner taught at the University of Washington. This included performing with the University of Washington Contemporary Group, along with the Soni Ventorum Wind Quintet and the Philadelphia String Quartet  Former students included Larry Tuttle
As part of the University of Washington Contemporary Group,  Ring Warner with soprano Elizabeth Suderburg, flutist Felix Skowronek, percussionist David Shrader and harpist Pamela Vokolek performed the premiereand recorded all four books of the Madrigals by George Crumb for Vox-Turnabout in 1972, that received a Grammy nomination in 1973.
